name: Matt Dexter
summary: My name is Matt Dexter. I'm a full-stack developer, a data analyst, and startup owner. I worked in IT the financial services industry for six years before co-founding my startup, ReviewLabs, Inc. In my past roles, I've worked extensively on analytics, web design, database management, and ETL. I'm primarily working in Python right now, but I've used Java and ColdFusion a lot in the past.

career.title: Co-Founder and CFO
highlights: Co-created the ReviewLabs business model
Created the customer-facing website https://reviewlabs.co
Co-created a Django/PostgreSQL Docker stack for AWS
Managed finance, accounting, and corporate governance

career.title: Sr. Assoc., Data Infrastructure
highlights: Developed a web-based inventory analysis & reporting platform
Developed and maintained a MySQL inventory datastore
Developed a suite of ETL tools with Java, SAS, and Teradata
Created a Java Spring/MySQL stack for Pivotal CloudFoundry
Managed GPFS and Teradata space constraints for 900+ users

career.title: Reporting & Analysis Manager
highlights: Administered a ColdFusion reporting site, database, and batch ETL
Managed a rapid app development team of 5 developers
Applied BI data strategies to develop new business processes
Administered code review, coaching, evaluations, and interviews

career.title: Sr. Reporting Analyst
highlights: Developed a ColdFusion reporting site, database, and batch ETL
Developed a learning management system for CFPB compliance
Developed ETL processes with Java and Teradata
Automated manual administrative tasks, reports, and processes

career.title: Sr. Credit Analyst
highlights: Conducted regular reviews of financial and credit information
Judgmentally determined cardmembersâ€™ lines of credit
Educated cardmembers about credit resources
